intro: Galium gonzaloi, commonly known as the Mexican bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with slender stems that often root at the nodes. Its small, white to pale pink flowers bloom in clusters during the summer months. Galium gonzaloi is typically found in rocky soils and dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
